title.narrative: ILO, 2015-2018, Improving Industrial Relations, textile ind

description.narrative:
Productive employment is the strongest link between economic growth and poverty alleviation. The aim of the project is to contribute to national development by supporting sustainable textile and garment industry. The focus will be on improved collaboration between the parties of the labour market, improved productivity, increased sallaries and improved working environment.
The results will be achieved by working on three levels: i) national level focusing onpolicy development, rules and regulations, institutional capacity development, ii) sector level with special focus on capacity development of labour market- and public actors and iii) capacity development at enterprise level with the aim of improving the social dialogue including collective bargaining. The trainig will among other things, focus on the rights and obligations of employers as well as employees. This understanding of each others roles and responsibilities is fundamental in order to develop a social dialogue which builds on mutual benefits and solid long-term relations.
In addition, the repressive situation in Ethiopia with a continously shrinking space for democratic actors, has limited the possibilities for the Embassy to work with democracy and Human Rights. Through the suggested programme, a new channel to strenthen democracy/HR will be developed.

Produktiv sysselsättning är den viktigaste länken mellan ekonomisk tillväxt och fattigdomsminskning. Projektets syfte är att bidra till nationell utveckling genom att stödja framväxten av en hållbar textil och beklädnadsindustri. Projektet fokuserar på förbättrade realtioner bland arbetsmarknades parter, ökad produktivitet, förbättrade löner och arbetsvillkor.
Resultaten skall uppnås genom en ansats som riktar sig till: i) nationell nivå med fokus på policyutveckling, regelverket, institutions- och kapacitetsutveckling för berörda aktörer, ii) sektornivå med fokus på kapacitetsutveckling av arbetsmarknadens parter samt offentliga aktörer och iii) kapacitetsutveckling på fabriksnivå av både arbetstagare och arbetsgivare i syfte att uppnå en förbättrad social dialog, inklusive kollektivavtal.
Vidare har den repressiva situationen i Etiopien med ett ständigt krympande utrymme för demokratiska aktörer, begränsat ambassadens möjligheter att arbeta inom resultatområdet demorkati och mänskliga rättigheter. Genom det föreslagna projektet utvecklas en ny kanal för att stärka den demokratiska utvecklingen och rättighetsagendan.

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2016Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The project has during the year of 2016 started off by carrying out a number of analysis and surveys in order to get a better picture of how the challenges and opportunities look like in the industry (garment). The programme has made an institutional mapping and a baseline survey to identify capacity gaps of industrial relations and labour administration institutions in Ethiopia at both federal and regional level. Further results are: 1. A number of forums have been established to facilitate the social dialouge. For example a multi-stakeholder dialogue forum have been established at national level and in Oromia and Tigray regions. The overall objective with the forum is to foster dialogue between government, private sector, trade unions, civil society organisations in order to be able to address key challenges facing the sector. 2. An Industrial Relations Service Center has been established as a one stop information center which will serve as a leading knowledge center on industrial relations and working conditions. The Ministry of Labor has allocated an office space for the centre and is currently finalising the recruitment of staff for the center. 3. A number of capacity development interventions have been carried out of the three parties; workers, employers and the government. This has resulted in an increased capacity in providing services to their members by both workers's and employers' organisations. 4. The programme has during the year been able to strengthen the capacity of the labor inspection bureaus. 45 Labour inspectors have during the year received training on how to conduct labor inspections and report writing after inspections. 5. At factory level focus has been on 10 selected factories and the programme has provided training to trade union leaders and factory management in occuaptional safety and health, collective bargaining and leadership training. This training has resulted in a better understanding among the parties of eachothers situation and roles and responsibilities. 6. Technical support has been provided to 5 factories on occupational safety and health. This technical support has generated that the factories have developed plans to improve safety and Health (OSH) at the workplace and four factories have developed and OSH policy and conducted risk assessments which were presented to the management of the factories. 7. The programme provided dialouge training for high and mid-level managers 8. Life skills training was provided to the workers in 8 factories. The training has improved the capacity on time mangement, financial literacy and awareness on the labor law.
